def utils.find_git_parent ( path)
Find the parent directory of a Git repository.
This function traverses up the directory structure from the given path to locate the nearest parent directory that contains a `.git` folder. If such a directory is found, it returns the path to that directory. If no Git repository is found in the specified path or any of its parent directories, it raises a custom exception.
Args: path (str): The path from which to start searching for the Git repository.
Returns: str: The absolute path to the parent directory containing the `.git` folder.
Raises: GitRepoNotFoundError: If no Git repository is found in the specified path or any
